New Records: Adolis García set a record for RBI in a postseason series with 15.
Bruce Bochy became the first skipper to win a League Championship Series with three different teams.
Texas Rangers joined the 1996 Yankees as the only teams to win their first eight road games in one postseason.
Adolis García's home run streak is tied for fourth-longest in postseason history.
Key Match Events: Adolis García homered twice and drove in five runs.
Corey Seager hit a long homer in a three-run first inning.
Nathaniel Lowe also hit a home run.
Alex Bregman hit a solo homer for the Astros.
Evan Carter hit a two-run double.
Adolis García hit a two-run single.
Jose Altuve hit his 27th career postseason homer in the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Adolis García expressed pride in the journey and improvement of the team.
Bruce Bochy reflected on his return to managing and the team's resilience.
Dusty Baker acknowledged the Astros' successful past four years despite the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Minute Maid Park in Houston.
The game lasted 3 hours and 20 minutes.
Umpires included Dan Bellino, Mark Ripperger, James Hoye, Doug Eddings, Marvin Hudson, and Jordan Baker.
